citations.narrative:
Seven primary enclosures housing a total of 30 puppies and 4 adult female dogs have excessively worn carpets. These
carpets are used to provide solid resting surfaces in whelping enclosures. However, the carpet fibers can become very
frayed and damaged from dogs chewing and scratching at them. This could serve as a source of potential injury to a dog
if these carpet fibers become ingested or wrap around their digits. Correct by ensuring materials used within a primary
enclosure are able to be repaired or replaced when worn or damaged. Correct from 4/8/24 onward.

The licensee is not following the Program of Vet Care for vaccinations. Of the 45 adult dogs, 6 are not up to date on all
three of the required vaccinations (distemper, parvovirus, and rabies). The current Program of Vet Care prescribes for the
vaccinations to be performed yearly.
- Adult male Poodle “Chip” # 3735 is overdue on the distemper vaccine. The distemper vaccine (NeoVac) was last given
on 11-5-22 and was due on 11-5-23. The parvovirus and rabies vaccines are current.
- Adult female Corgi “Gabby” #5657 is overdue on the distemper vaccine. The distemper vaccine (NeoVac) was last given
on 11-5-22 and was due on 11-5-23. The parvovirus and rabies vaccines are current.
- Adult female Maltese “Juliet” #5667 is overdue on the distemper vaccine. The distemper vaccine (NeoVac) was last
given on 11-5-22 and was due on 11-5-23. The parvovirus and rabies vaccines are current.
- Adult female Shih Tzu “Kallie” #9835 is overdue on the distemper vaccine. The distemper vaccine (NeoVac) was last
given on 11-5-22 and was due on 11-5-23. The parvovirus and rabies vaccines are current.
- Adult female Shih Tzu “Konnie” #3837 is overdue on the distemper vaccine. The distemper vaccine (NeoVac) was last
given on 11-5-22 and was due on 11-5-23. The parvovirus and rabies vaccines are current.
- Adult female Poodle “Prudence” #9802 is overdue on the distemper and parvovirus vaccines. They were last given on 3-
30-22 and was due on 3-30-23. The rabies vaccine is current.
Distemper, parvovirus, and rabies are life-threatening diseases and, if contracted, may cause pain, distress, and suffering.
It is also important for breeding females to be vaccinated as they will pass immunity to their offspring through their milk.
Correct by vaccinating for distemper, parvovirus, and rabies in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending
Veterinarian and vaccine manufacturer recommendations.
Correct by 4/8/2024 onward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.6(a)(2)(ix) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Seven primary enclosures housing a total of 30 puppies and 4 adult female dogs have excessively worn carpets. These 
carpets are used to provide solid resting surfaces in whelping enclosures. However, the carpet fibers can become very 
frayed and damaged from dogs chewing and scratching at them. This could serve as a source of potential injury to a dog 
if these carpet fibers become ingested or wrap around their digits. Correct by ensuring materials used within a primary 
enclosure are able to be repaired or replaced when worn or damaged. Correct from 4/8/24 onward. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee is not following the Program of Vet Care for vaccinations. Of the 45 adult dogs, 6 are not up to date on all 
three of the required vaccinations (distemper, parvovirus, and rabies). The current Program of Vet Care prescribes for the 
vaccinations to be performed yearly. 
 
- Adult male Poodle “Chip” # 3735 is overdue on the distemper vaccine. The distemper vaccine (NeoVac) was last given 
on 11-5-22 and was due on 11-5-23. The parvovirus and rabies vaccines are current. 
- Adult female Corgi “Gabby” #5657 is overdue on the distemper vaccine. The distemper vaccine (NeoVac) was last given 
on 11-5-22 and was due on 11-5-23. The parvovirus and rabies vaccines are current. 
- Adult female Maltese “Juliet” #5667 is overdue on the distemper vaccine. The distemper vaccine (NeoVac) was last 
given on 11-5-22 and was due on 11-5-23. The parvovirus and rabies vaccines are current. 
- Adult female Shih Tzu “Kallie” #9835 is overdue on the distemper vaccine. The distemper vaccine (NeoVac) was last 
given on 11-5-22 and was due on 11-5-23. The parvovirus and rabies vaccines are current. 
- Adult female Shih Tzu “Konnie” #3837 is overdue on the distemper vaccine. The distemper vaccine (NeoVac) was last 
given on 11-5-22 and was due on 11-5-23. The parvovirus and rabies vaccines are current. 
- Adult female Poodle “Prudence” #9802 is overdue on the distemper and parvovirus vaccines. They were last given on 3-
30-22 and was due on 3-30-23. The rabies vaccine is current. 
 
Distemper, parvovirus, and rabies are life-threatening diseases and, if contracted, may cause pain, distress, and suffering. 
It is also important for breeding females to be vaccinated as they will pass immunity to their offspring through their milk. 
Correct by vaccinating for distemper, parvovirus, and rabies in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending

Veterinarian and vaccine manufacturer recommendations.  
 
Correct by 4/8/2024 onward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
